results.title: Margaree people
results.brief_description: An affectionate look at the people of the Margaree Valley in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, by a Nantucket Islander and skilled photographer who has come to live among them. George Thomas has documented the rustic character of the Margaree people in an arresting collection of photographs. There, together with live-action scenes filmed in autumn, produce a nostalgic study of a passing way of life.

results.title: Marey
results.brief_description:
In 1862, Etienne-Jules Marey, a French physiologist, with an interest in movement, devised a camera with magazine plates that recorded a series of photographs. Once combined, the pictures would represent movement, and in particluar, the flight of birds. Marey’s invention is regarded as a forerunner of the modermn motion picture camera. See also: ‘Pioneers of Photography’ (Ep.07): ‘The Fleeting Image’ (Available on VHS and 16mm).

Credits: No credits available.

results.title: Marco Polo's travels
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hal Kopel
results.brief_description: Marco Polo wrote a book of his travels in 1298, when he was a POW. He was 17 when he left Venice on his journey. This film tells the story of Marco Polo’s travels to China and back to Europe. An animated map traces his historic journey.

results.title: Marching the colours
results.brief_description: An experiment in film animation, visualising a well-known military march in geometric, abstract patterns of colour. Bold hues move, march, blend and separate in a dynamic pattern of mobile forms, transporting into colour and shape the sound patterns of the accompanying music. This film made by Guy Glover, without use of a camera.

results.title: Marcel Proust: from masterpieces to a master's work
results.creator_credit: C A P A C and Jacques Letellier
results.brief_description: Intended to deepen our appreciation and understanding of Proust’s works by reviewing some of the masterpieces of art and music which inspired him and led him to recognise his vocation as a writer. The effect of the Dreyfus case and the Great War are indicated and the lack of interest in his work during his lifetime.

results.title: Marcel
results.brief_description: Marcel stands aloft on a balcony as he watches 6 pallbearers carry an empty coffin; the pallbearers are coming for him. Cast includes John Bailey, Christopher Palmer, Johannes Davies, Davidson Wire, James Reg and William Frew.

results.title: Marceau on Mime
results.brief_description: Marcel Marceau, world famous French mime, talks about his life and work, about his theories on mime and the history of pantomime in the theatre. He traces mime through the Greek theatre, the commedia del’arte, the Pierrot of the 19th century and the comics of film, like Chaplin, Keaton, Lloyd, and Laurel and Hardy. Marceau started out to be a painter and still does drawings and paintings. He feels that mime is closely related to the graphic arts as well as to music and dance.

results.title: Marc Chagall/the colours of passion
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Charles Harris
results.brief_description: Focuses on the diverse artistic achievements of Marc Chagall. Explains his often perplexing subject matter and passion for colour in terms of his stated desire to create a world where anything is possible. Includes examples of his work, along with a discussion of his background and the influences of impressionism, cubism and Russia on his inspiration. Cameraman by Derek Waterman; quotations by Cyril Shaps and commentary by Paul Gregory. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Marbles
results.brief_description: Edward fears he is losing his grip on reality. Outwardly, he appears grumpier. Eventually he tells his wife she is the only thing that he can remember - but can she help him and what can be done? A poignant film about ageing, shot in black and white featuring Willie Fennell, Moya O’Sullivan and Noni Hazlehurst.

results.title: Marathon the ultimate challenge
results.creator_credit: Marathon Film Productions, Alan Jacques and Patrick Ramsey
results.brief_description: An award winning film about the determination, the satisfaction and the exhilaration of running a marathon. This film takes the viewer into a marathon and gives insight into what a runner experiences. This is more than a sports film - it is a film about setting a goal, working towards it and achieving it.
